name: Chike
description:
'''Chike Ezekpeazu Osebuka''' (born 28 January 1993), better known as '''Chike''', is a Nigerian singer, songwriter and actor. He gained prominence as a contestant on ''[[Project Fame West Africa]]''. Additionally, he showcased his talents on ''[[The Voice Nigeria]]'', where he achieved the second position during Season 1. Chike ventured into acting by making his debut as Mayowa Badmus on the [[Africa Magic|Africa Magic Showcase]] telenovela ''[[Battleground (Nigerian TV series)|Battleground]]''. He also appeared in the film ''[[Gangs of Lagos|Gang of Lagos]]'', portraying the character Ify.

Chike released his debut studio album, ''[[Boo of the Booless]]'', on 14 February 2020. His second studio album, ''The Brother's Keeper'', was released in 2022.

Chike is a Nigerian singer, songwriter, and actor. His music style is a fusion of R&B, soul, and Afro-pop. Chike gained popularity with his hit single "Amen" and has since released several successful songs and albums.

Chike's music is known for its soulful and emotive sound, and he has been praised for his vocal range and songwriting skills. He has also been nominated for several music awards, including the Headies and the Nigerian Entertainment Awards.

As an actor, Chike has appeared in several Nigerian movies and TV shows, including the popular TV series "BattleGround".
